verses.verse: The word <WH1697> of the YY <WH3068> which came to Yirmeyah-yahu <WH3414> the prophet <WH5030> against the goyim <WH1471>;

Against Egypt <WH4714>, against the army <WH2428> of PharaohN'kho <WH6549> king <WH4428> of Egypt <WH4714>, which was by the river <WH5104> Euphrates <WH6578> in Kark'mish <WH3751>, which Nebuchadrezzar <WH5019> king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894> smote <WH5221> <WH8689> in the fourth <WH7243> year <WH8141> of Y'hoyakim <WH3079> the son <WH1121> of Yoshiyah-yahu <WH2977> king <WH4428> of Y'hudah <WH3063>.
Order <WH6186> <WH8798> ye the buckler <WH4043> and shield <WH6793>, and draw near <WH5066> <WH8798> to battle <WH4421>.

Harness <WH631> <WH8798> the horses <WH5483>; and get up <WH5927> <WH8798>, ye horsemen <WH6571>, and stand forth <WH3320> <WH8690> with your helmets <WH3553>; furbish <WH4838> <WH8798> the spears <WH7420>, and put on <WH3847> <WH8798> the brigandines <WH5630>.

Wherefore have I seen <WH7200> <WH8804> them dismayed <WH2844> and turned <WH5472> <WH8737> away back <WH268>? and their mighty ones <WH1368> are beaten down <WH3807> <WH8714>, and are fled <WH5127> <WH8804> apace <WH4498>, and look not back <WH6437> <WH8689>: for fear <WH4032> was round about <WH5439>, saith <WH5002> <WH8803> the YY <WH3068>.

Let not the swift <WH7031> flee away <WH5127> <WH8799>, nor the mighty man <WH1368> escape <WH4422> <WH8735>; they shall stumble <WH3782> <WH8804>, and fall <WH5307> <WH8804> toward the north <WH6828> by <WH3027> the river <WH5104> Euphrates <WH6578>.
Who is this that cometh up <WH5927> <WH8799> as a flood <WH2975>, whose waters <WH4325> are moved <WH1607> <WH8691> as the rivers <WH5104> ?

Egypt <WH4714> riseht up <WH5927> <WH8799> like a flood <WH2975>, and his waters <WH4325> are moved <WH1607> <WH8704> like the rivers <WH5104>; and he saith <WH559> <WH8799>, I will go up <WH5927> <WH8799>, and will cover <WH3680> <WH8762> the earth <WH776>; I will destroy <WH6> <WH8686> the city <WH5892> and the inhabitants <WH3427> <WH8802> thereof.

Come up <WH5927> <WH8798>, ye horses <WH5483>; and rage <WH1984> <WH8703>, ye chariots <WH7393>; and let the mighty men <WH1368> come forth <WH3318> <WH8799>; the Ethiopians <WH3568> and the Libyans <WH6316>, that handle <WH8610> <WH8802> the shield <WH4043>; and the Lydians <WH3866>, that handle <WH8610> <WH8802> and bend <WH1869> <WH8802> the bow <WH7198>.

For this is the day <WH3117> of the YY <WH136> GOD <WH3069> TZva'ot <WH6635>, a day <WH3117> of vengeance <WH5360>, that he may avenge <WH5358> <WH8736> him of his adversaries <WH6862>: and the sword <WH2719> shall devour <WH398> <WH8804>, and it shall be satiate <WH7646> <WH8804> and made drunk <WH7301> <WH8804> with their blood <WH1818>: for the YY <WH136> GOD <WH3069> TZva'ot <WH6635> hath a sacrifice <WH2077> in the north <WH6828> country <WH776> by the river <WH5104> Euphrates <WH6578>.

Go up <WH5927> <WH8798> into Gil`ad <WH1568>, and take <WH3947> <WH8798> balm <WH6875>, O virgin <WH1330>, the daughter <WH1323> of Egypt <WH4714>: in vain <WH7723> shalt thou use many <WH7235> <WH8689> medicines <WH7499>; for thou shalt not be cured <WH8585>.

The nations <WH1471> have heard <WH8085> <WH8804> of thy shame <WH7036>, and thy cry <WH6682> hath filled <WH4390> <WH8804> the land <WH776>: for the mighty man <WH1368> hath stumbled <WH3782> <WH8804> against the mighty <WH1368>, and they are fallen <WH5307> <WH8804> both <WH8147> together <WH3162>.

The word <WH1697> that the YY <WH3068> spake <WH1696> <WH8765> to Yirmeyah-yahu <WH3414> the prophet <WH5030>, how Nebuchadrezzar <WH5019> king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894> should come <WH935> <WH8800> and smite <WH5221> <WH8687> the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>.

Declare <WH5046> <WH8685> ye in Egypt <WH4714>, and publish <WH8085> <WH8685> in Migdol <WH4024>, and publish <WH8085> <WH8685> in Noph <WH5297> and in Tahpanhes <WH8471>: say <WH559> <WH8798> ye, Stand fast <WH3320> <WH8690>, and prepare <WH3559> <WH8685> thee; for the sword <WH2719> shall devour <WH398> <WH8804> round about <WH5439> thee.
Why are thy valiant <WH47> men swept away <WH5502> <WH8738>? they stood <WH5975> <WH8804> not, because the YY <WH3068> did drive <WH1920> <WH8804> them.

He made many <WH7235> <WH8689> to fall <WH3782> <WH8802>, yea, one <WH376> fell <WH5307> <WH8804> upon another <WH7453>: and they said <WH559> <WH8799>, Arise <WH6965> <WH8798>, and let us go again <WH7725> <WH8799> to our own people <WH5971>, and to the land <WH776> of our nativity <WH4138>, from <WH6440> the oppressing <WH3238> <WH8802> sword <WH2719>.
They did cry <WH7121> <WH8804> there, Pharaoh <WH6547> king <WH4428> of Egypt <WH4714> is but a noise <WH7588>; he hath passed <WH5674> <WH8689> the time appointed <WH4150>.

As I live <WH2416>, saith <WH5002> <WH8803> the King <WH4428>, whose name <WH8034> is the YY <WH3068> TZva'ot <WH6635>, Surely as Tavor <WH8396> is among the mountains <WH2022>, and as Karmel <WH3760> by the sea <WH3220>, so shall he come <WH935> <WH8799>.

O thou daughter <WH1323> dwelling <WH3427> <WH8802> in Egypt <WH4714>, furnish <WH6213> <WH8798> thyself to go into captivity <WH3627> <WH1473>: for Noph <WH5297> shall be waste <WH8047> and desolate <WH3341> <WH8738> without an inhabitant <WH3427> <WH8802>.
Egypt <WH4714> is like a very fair <WH3304> heifer <WH5697>, but destruction <WH7171> cometh <WH935> <WH8804>; it cometh out <WH935> <WH8804> of the north <WH6828>.

Also her hired men <WH7916> are in the midst <WH7130> of her like fatted <WH4770> bullocks <WH5695>; for they also are turned back <WH6437> <WH8689>, and are fled away <WH5127> <WH8804> together <WH3162>: they did not stand <WH5975> <WH8804>, because the day <WH3117> of their calamity <WH343> was come <WH935> <WH8804> upon them, and the time <WH6256> of their visitation <WH6486>.

The voice <WH6963> thereof shall go <WH3212> <WH8799> like a serpent <WH5175>; for they shall march <WH3212> <WH8799> with an army <WH2428>, and come <WH935> <WH8804> against her with axes <WH7134>, as hewers <WH2404> <WH8802> of wood <WH6086>.

They shall cut down <WH3772> <WH8804> her forest <WH3293>, saith <WH5002> <WH8803> the YY <WH3068>, though it cannot be searched <WH2713> <WH8735>; because they are more <WH7231> <WH8804> than the grasshoppers <WH697>, and are innumerable <WH369> <WH4557>.
The daughter <WH1323> of Egypt <WH4714> shall be confounded <WH3001> <WH8689>; she shall be delivered <WH5414> <WH8738> into the hand <WH3027> of the people <WH5971> of the north <WH6828>.

The YY <WH3068> TZva'ot <WH6635>, the 'Elohim <WH430> of Yisra'EL <WH3478>, saith <WH559> <WH8804>; Behold, I will punish <WH6485> <WH8802> the multitude <WH527> <WH8676> <WH528> of No <WH4996>, and Pharaoh <WH6547>, and Egypt <WH4714>, with their 'elohim <WH430>, and their kings <WH4428>; even Pharaoh <WH6547>, and all them that trust <WH982> <WH8802> in him:

And I will deliver <WH5414> <WH8804> them into the hand <WH3027> of those that seek <WH1245> <WH8764> their lives <WH5315>, and into the hand <WH3027> of Nebuchadrezzar <WH5019> king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894>, and into the hand <WH3027> of his servants <WH5650>: and afterward <WH310> it shall be inhabited <WH7931> <WH8799>, as in the days <WH3117> of old <WH6924>, saith <WH5002> <WH8803> the YY <WH3068>.

But fear <WH3372> <WH8799> not thou, O my servant <WH5650> Ya`akov <WH3290>, and be not dismayed <WH2865> <WH8735>, O Yisra'EL <WH3478>: for, behold, I will save <WH3467> <WH8688> thee from afar off <WH7350>, and thy seed <WH2233> from the land <WH776> of their captivity <WH7628>; and Ya`akov <WH3290> shall return <WH7725> <WH8804>, and be in rest <WH8252> <WH8804> and at ease <WH7599> <WH8768>, and none shall make him afraid <WH2729> <WH8688>.

Fear <WH3372> <WH8799> thou not, O Ya`akov <WH3290> my servant <WH5650>, saith <WH5002> <WH8803> the YY <WH3068>: for I am with thee; for I will make <WH6213> <WH8799> a full end <WH3617> of all the nations <WH1471> whither I have driven <WH5080> <WH8689> thee: but I will not make <WH6213> <WH8799> a full end <WH3617> of thee, but correct <WH3256> <WH8765> thee in measure <WH4941>; yet will I not leave thee wholly <WH5352> <WH8763> unpunished <WH5352> <WH8762>.
